Regulation (EU) 2023/2055, recital 18, explains that ‘derogations from the ban on placing on the
market are proposed where the risk from releases is expected to be minimised because synthetic
polymer microparticles are contained by technical means, such as those in chromatography
columns, water filtering cartridges or printer toners, or permanently lose their particle form
because, for example, they swell or form a film, like in diapers, nail polish or paint, or are
